title: The World changes: Japan's geography - human and economic
creator_credit: Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Hugh Gage
brief_description: Outlines the geographical features of the four mountainous islands of Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu, their climate and population density. Also covers the impact of modernisation, the growth of the cities, particularly Tokyo, the way of life in the country, research and technology, the basis of the economy and the skill and industry of the people.
